questions.text:
#### Q3. What is the name for calling a function inside the same function?

- %OPTION% recursion
- %OPTION% subfunction
- %OPTION% inner call
- %OPTION% infinite loop

[Reference](https://www.cprogramming.com/tutorial/c/lesson16.html)

#### Q6. Header files are listed using the preprocessing directive #include, and can have one of the following formats: #include <fileA> or #include "fileB". What is the difference between these two formats?

- %OPTION% The preprocessor will try to locate fileA in same directory as the source file, and the fileB in a predetermined directory path.
- %OPTION% The preprocessor will try to locate fileA in the fixed system directory. It will try to locate fileB in the directory path designated by the -I option added to the command line while compiling the source code.
- %OPTION% The file using the fileA syntax must be system files, of unlimited number; fileB must be a user file at a maximun of one per source file.
- %OPTION% The preprocessor will try to locate fileA in a predetermined directory path. It will try to locate fileB in the same directory as the source file along with a custom directory path.

[Reference](https://www.geeksforgeeks.org/difference-between-include-and-include-in-c-c-with-examples/#:~:text=The%20difference%20between%20the%20two,be%20included%20in%20the%20code.&text=%23include%20is%20for%20pre%2Ddefined%20header%20files.)

#### Q8. What is not one of the reserved words in standard C?

- %OPTION% volatile
- %OPTION% typeof
- %OPTION% register
- %OPTION% typedef

[Reference](https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/adfz/developer-for-zos/14.2.0?topic=programs-c-reserved-keywords)

#### Q13. What is optional in a function declaration?

- %OPTION% data type of parameters
- %OPTION% return type of function
- %OPTION% parameter names
- %OPTION% number of parameters

[Reference](https://www.cprogramming.com/tutorial/c/lesson4.html)

#### Q14. C treats all devices, such as the display and the keyboard, as files. Which file opens automatically when a program executes?

- %OPTION% stdout
- %OPTION% stdio.h
- %OPTION% default.h
- %OPTION% string.h

#### Q15. In which segment does dynamic memory allocation takes place?

- %OPTION% BSS Segment
- %OPTION% stack
- %OPTION% heap
- %OPTION% data segment

[Reference](http://www.it.uc3m.es/pbasanta/asng/course_notes/dynamic_memory_heap_en.html#:~:text=The%20dynamic%20memory%20that%20is,reads%20a%20set%20of%20words.)

#### Q16. Which function do you use to deallocate memory?

- %OPTION% dalloc()
- %OPTION% dealloc()
- %OPTION% release()
- %OPTION% free()

[Reference](https://devdocs.io/c/memory/free)

[Reference](https://www.tutorialspoint.com/c_standard_library/c_function_free.htm)

#### Q17. In C language what are the basic building blocks that are constructed together to write a program?

- %OPTION% keywords
- %OPTION% identifiers
- %OPTION% tokens
- %OPTION% functions

[Reference](https://fresh2refresh.com/c-programming/c-tokens-identifiers-keywords/#:~:text=C%20tokens%20are%20the%20basic,are%20known%20as%20C%20tokens.)

#### Q18. When is memory for a variable allocated?

- %OPTION% during the assigment of the variable
- %OPTION% during the initialization of the variable
- %OPTION% during the declaration of the variable
- %OPTION% during the definition of the variable

[Reference](https://www.codingame.com/playgrounds/14589/how-to-play-with-pointers-in-c/dynamic-memory-allocation#:~:text=When%20a%20variable%20is%20declared,allocation%20or%20dynamic%20memory%20allocation.)

#### Q19. C uses the call by value method to pass arguments to functions. How can you invoke the call by reference method?

- %OPTION% by using pointers
- %OPTION% by declaring functions separately from defining them
- %OPTION% by using recursive functions
- %OPTION% by using global variables

[Reference](https://www.javatpoint.com/call-by-value-and-call-by-reference-in-c)

#### Q20. A union allows you to store different `___` in the same `___`.

- %OPTION% Objects; Structure
- %OPTION% Variables; Declaration
- %OPTION% Data types; Memory space
- %OPTION% Arrays; Header file

#### Q22. What is the difference between scanf() and sscanf() functions?

- %OPTION% The scanf() function reads data formatted as a string; The sscanf() function reads string input from the screen.
- %OPTION% The scanf() function reads formatted data from the keyboard; The sscanf() function reads formatted input from a string.
- %OPTION% The scanf() function reads string data from the keyboard; The sscanf() function reads string data from a string.
- %OPTION% The scanf() function reads formatted data from a file; The sscanf() function reads input from a selected string

#### Q23. What is not a valid command with this declaration?

```c
char *string[20] = { "one", "two", "three"};
```

- %OPTION% `printf("%c", string[1][2]);`
- %OPTION% `printf("%s", string[1][2]);`
- %OPTION% `printf("%s", string[1]);`
- %OPTION% `printf(string[1]);`

#### Q24. What is the expression player->name equivalent to?

- %OPTION% `player.name`
- %OPTION% `(*player).name`
- %OPTION% `*player.name`
- %OPTION% `player.*name`

#### Q26. What does this function call return?

```c
1 main() { float x = f1(10, 5); }
2 float f1(int a, int b) { return (a/b); }
```

- %OPTION% 2
- %OPTION% 2.000000
- %OPTION% a runtime error
- %OPTION% a compiler error

#### Q28. What is an alternative way to write the expression (\*x).y?

- %OPTION% There is no equivalent.
- %OPTION% x->y
- %OPTION% \*x->y
- %OPTION% y->x

#### Q29. Compile time errors are static errors that can be found where in the code?

- %OPTION% in declarations and definitions
- %OPTION% in functions and expressions
- %OPTION% in syntax and semantics
- %OPTION% in objects and statements

#### Q30. File input and output (I/O) in C is heavily based on the way it is done `___`?

- %OPTION% in Unix
- %OPTION% in C++
- %OPTION% in C#
- %OPTION% in DOS

#### Q31. What does the strcmp(str1, str2); function return?

- %OPTION% 0 if str1 and str2 are the same, a negative number if str1 is less than str2, a positive number if str1 is greater than str2
- %OPTION% true (1) if str1 and str2 are the same, false (0) if str1 and str2 are not the same
- %OPTION% true (1) if str1 and str2 are the same, NULL if str1 and str2 are not the same
- %OPTION% 0 if str1 and str2 are the same, a negative number if str2 is less than str1, a positive number if str2 is greater than str1

#### Q33. Which is _not_ a correct way to declare a string variable?

- %OPTION% `char *string = "Hello World";`
- %OPTION% `char string = "Hello World";`
- %OPTION% `char string[20] = {'H', 'e', 'l', 'l', 'o', ' ', 'W', 'o', 'r', 'l', 'd'};`
- %OPTION% `char string[] = "Hello World";`

#### Q34. Which choice is an include guard for the header file mylib.h?

- %OPTION% :

```c
#ifdef MYLIB_H
#undef MYLIB_H

// mylib.h content

#endif /* MYLIB_H */
```

- %OPTION% :

```c
#ifndef MYLIB_H
#define MYLIB_H

// mylib.h content

#endif /* MYLIB_H */
```

- %OPTION% :

```c
#define MYLIB_H
#include "mylib.h"

#undef MYLIB_H
```

- %OPTION% :

```c
#ifdef MYLIB_H
#define MYLIB_H

// mylib.h content

#endif /* MYLIB_H */
```

#### Q36. File input and output (I/O) in C is done through what?

- %OPTION% syntax-driven components
- %OPTION% native interfaces
- %OPTION% system objects
- %OPTION% function calls

#### Q37. Directives are translated by the?

- %OPTION% Pre-processor
- %OPTION% Compiler
- %OPTION% Linker
- %OPTION% Editor

#### Q38. The main loop structures in C programming are the for loop, the while loop, and which other loop?

- %OPTION% do...while
- %OPTION% for...in
- %OPTION% repeat...until
- %OPTION% do...until

#### Q39. By default, C Functions are what type of functions?

- %OPTION% global
- %OPTION% static
- %OPTION% library
- %OPTION% system

#### Q41. A Stack data structure allows all data operations at one end only, making it what kind of an implementation?

- %OPTION% FIFO
- %OPTION% LIFO
- %OPTION% LILO
- %OPTION% LOLI

#### Q43. Describe the relationship between lvalue and rvalue.

- %OPTION% An lvalue may appear only on the left-hand side of an assignment; an rvalue may appear only on the right-hand side.
- %OPTION% An lvalue may appear only on the left-hand side of an assignment; an rvalue may appear on either the left-hand or right-hand side.
- %OPTION% An lvalue and an rvalue may appear on either left-hand or right-hand side of an assignment.
- %OPTION% An lvalue may appear on the left-hand or right-hand side of an assignment; an rvalue may appear only on the right-hand side.

#### Q44. Which operator is used to access the address of a variable?

- %OPTION% `%`
- %OPTION% `**`
- %OPTION% `*`
- %OPTION% `&`

#### Q47. Which is _not_ a storage class specifier?

- %OPTION% `intern`
- %OPTION% `extern`
- %OPTION% `register`
- %OPTION% `static`

[Reference](https://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/language/storage_duration)

#### Q48. Which line of code, after execution, results in `i` having the value of 1?

- %OPTION% `for(i=1; i<=1; i++);`
- %OPTION% `for(i=1; i=10; i++);`
- %OPTION% `for(i=1; i==10; i++);`
- %OPTION% `for(i=10; i>=1; i--);`

#### Q50. What is _not_ one of the basic data types in C

- %OPTION% long double
- %OPTION% unsigned char
- %OPTION% array
- %OPTION% float

#### Q51. What is the member access operator for a structure?

- %OPTION% ,
- %OPTION% []
- %OPTION% .
- %OPTION% :

#### Q52. What standard data type provides the smallest storage size and can be used in computations?

- %OPTION% char
- %OPTION% float
- %OPTION% int
- %OPTION% short

#### Q53. what does the ctype tolower() function do?

- %OPTION% It returns TRUE for lowercase letters of the alphabet.
- %OPTION% It ensures that text output uses only ASCII values (0 through 127).
- %OPTION% It returns FALSE for lowercase letters of the alphabet.
- %OPTION% It converts an uppercase letter of the alphabet to lowercase.

#### Q54. Void pointer _vptr_ is assigned the address of float variable _g_. What is a valid way to dereference _vptr_ to assign its pointed value to a float variable named _f_ later in the program?

```c
float g;
void *vptr=&g;
```

- %OPTION% `f=(float *)vptr;`
- %OPTION% `f=*(float *)vptr;`
- %OPTION% `f=*(float)vptr;`
- %OPTION% `f=(float)*vptr;`

#### Q55. The dynamic memory allocation functions are defined in which system header file ?

- %OPTION% stdio.h
- %OPTION% stdlib.h
- %OPTION% limits.h
- %OPTION% stddef.h

#### Q56. A function is a set of **\_**.

- %OPTION% declarations
- %OPTION% statements
- %OPTION% variables
- %OPTION% objects

#### Q57. How are static functions different from global functions?

- %OPTION% Static functions must be declared in advance of being defined.
- %OPTION% Static functions must be declared is a separate header file.
- %OPTION% Static functions always return the same value.
- %OPTION% Static functions can be accessed only in the file where they are declared.

#### Q59. If you use the fopen() function with the "a" mode, what happens if the named file doesn't exist?

- %OPTION% The file is created and opened for reading.
- %OPTION% The file is created and opened for writing.
- %OPTION% The fopen() function returns a NULL indicating that the operation has failed.
- %OPTION% The file is created and opened for both writing and reading

[Reference](https://www.tutorialspoint.com/c_standard_library/c_function_fopen.htm)

#### Q60. What does this function return?

```c
int fl(int a, int b) { return(a>b?a:b); }
```

- %OPTION% compiler error
- %OPTION% the smaller value of the two passed parameters
- %OPTION% runtime error
- %OPTION% the greater value of the two passed parameters

#### Q61. Which function fo you use to deallocate memory?

- %OPTION% free()
- %OPTION% dealloc()
- %OPTION% release()
- %OPTION% dealloc()

#### Q62. Which option is a valid function name?

- %OPTION% draw_star()
- %OPTION% 5times()
- %OPTION% upper-limit()
- %OPTION% auto()

#### Q64. What is the output of the below program?

```c
#include <stdio.h>
#if X == 3
    #define Y 3
#else
    #define Y 5
#endif

int main()
{
    printf("%d", Y);
    return 0;
}
```

- %OPTION% 3
- %OPTION% 5
- %OPTION% 3 or 5 depending on input
- %OPTION% Compile time error

#### Q65. What do the functions malloc() and calloc() allocate?

- %OPTION% reallocatged memory
- %OPTION% static memeory
- %OPTION% dynamic memory
- %OPTION% fragmented memory

[Reference](https://devdocs.io/c/memory/calloc , https://devdocs.io/c/memory/malloc )

#### Q68. Predict the output of the following code when the **interger** variables x is initialized to 10,y to 2 and z to 0.

```c
z = x + y * x + 10 / 2 * x;
printf("value is =%d",z);
```

- %OPTION% 80
- %OPTION% 170
- %OPTION% 31.5
- %OPTION% 6

[Reference](https://www.informit.com/articles/article.aspx?p=2062174&seqNum=4)

#### Q71. What is /0 character ?

- %OPTION% String
- %OPTION% NULL Character
- %OPTION% ZERO
- %OPTION% Variable

[Reference](<https://www.youth4work.com/Talent/C-Language/Forum/117150-what-is-the-use-of-a-0-character-in-c-language#:~:text=by%20using%20of%20null%20character(%27%5C0%27)%20it%20terminates%20the%20string%20untill%20the%20null%20character%20hit...%20which%20means%20comes%20out%20of%20the%20loop...%20In%20strings%20by%20default%20takes%20the%20null%20charater>)

#### Q73. What is Incorrect option that explain # pragma directive ?

- %OPTION% #pragma exit allows us to specify functions called upon program exit.
- %OPTION% This is a preprocessor directive that can be used to turn on or off certain features.
- %OPTION% #pragma startup don't allows us to specify functions called upon program startup.
- %OPTION% It is of two types #pragma startup, #pragma exit and pragma warn.

#### Q78. What does the following declaration mean?

```
int (*ptr)[10];
```

- %OPTION% ptr is array of pointers to 10 integers
- %OPTION% ptr is a pointer to an array of 10 integers
- %OPTION% ptr is an array of 10 integers
- %OPTION% ptr is an pointer to array

#### Q85. Choose true or false.When variable is created in C, a memory address is assigned to the variable.

- %OPTION% True
- %OPTION% False

#### Q88. What will be the output of the following C program segment?

```c
char inchar = 'A';
switch (inchar)
{
case 'A' :
	printf ("choice A \n") ;
case 'B' :
	printf ("choice B ") ;
case 'C' :
case 'D' :
case 'E' :
default:
	printf ("No Choice") ;
}

```

- %OPTION% No choice
- %OPTION% Choice A
- %OPTION% Choice A
      Choice B No choice
- %OPTION% Program gives no output as it is erroneous
